mapper.sql: select t.user_id as userId, t.login_name as loginName, t.user_name as userName , t.user_type as userType, t.password , t.telphone, t.email, t.address , t.create_time as createTime, t.remark
mapper.insert: insert into BT_T_USER (user_id, login_name, user_name, user_type, password, telphone, email, address, create_time, remark) values (#{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{loginName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{password,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{telphone,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createTime,jdbcType=DATE}, #{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR})
mapper.update: update BT_T_USER t set t.login_name=#{loginName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, t.user_name=#{userName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, t.telphone=#{telphone,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, t.email=#{email,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, t.address=#{address,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, t.remark=#{remark,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where t.user_id=#{userId}
mapper.select:
from BT_T_USER t
and t.user_id = #{userId}
and instr(t.login_name,#{loginName}) >0
and instr(t.user_name,#{userName}) >0
and t.user_type = #{userType}
and instr(t.telphone,#{telphone}) >0
and instr(t.email,#{email}) >0
and instr(t.address, #{address}) >0
order by t.create_time desc
from BT_T_USER t where t.login_name=#{loginName} and t.password=#{password} and t.user_type=#{userType}
